about_intro: We are an organization dedicated to supporting the village of Qyteza and uniting Qytezars worldwide. Founded in Illinois, we continue to preserve our cultural heritage and strengthen our community ties.
about_text: The Progress – Benevolent Society of Qyteza was founded by Albanian immigrants in the United States around 1918. During a time of great change for the Albanian people, the society served as a bridge between the homeland and the diaspora, providing support to improve life in the village of Qytezë. In its early years, the organization contributed to the construction of key infrastructure including a school, water supply system, and the restoration of local churches. After being inactive during the communist era, the society was revitalized in 1992–1995 by a new generation of members in both Albania and the diaspora. With the adoption of an official statute in Korçë in 1992, the society set forth a vision to preserve the cultural identity of Qytezars, reconnect families, and promote educational and cultural activities.
